Hsuan Lee

Currently, I am studying Master of Computer Science in University of Illinois, Urbarna-Champaign .

I got my BS degree in Computer Science from National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University, where I was a research assistant in Wireless Internet Research and Engineering Laboratory and an infrastructure engineer in Computer Center.

I participated in two academia-indusrty projects. As a program engineer, I led a team of two to design a multi-kubernetes management platform, decreasing 50% of administrative cost and lowered 80% of time to test switches Software-Defined Network functionalities by a Python testing pipeline respectively.

From Jun 2021 to Sep 2021, I worked at Google, as part of Data Center intern. I primarily maintained systems and network in the biggest Google Data Center in Asia. Additionally, I Automated technicians’ routine by a low cost embedded systems and full-stack application on GCP, reducing 10% of workload.

Email  /  GitHub  /  LinkedIn

Research

I am interested in Kubernetes and Software-Defined Network topics.

A Dynamic on-demand Virtual Customer Premises Equipment Infrastructure


Lee Hsuan
National Science Council, 2022
arxiv / slides /

This research develops a “Dynamic On-demand Infrastructure for Virtualized Client Equipment”, based on ETSI Network Function Virtualization (NFV) architecture, and conforms to BBF TR317 standard of Network Enhanced Residential Gateway (NERG). The containerized-base virtual customer premises equipment (vCPE) infrastructure leveraging Kubernetes and Software Define Network (SDN) to improve availability, flexibility, and manageability, achieving a 75% reduction in hardware costs for telecom companies.

A Kebernetes Solution for NAT Traveral


Lee Hsuan
National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University, 2022

Research a new K8s architecture without single-point failure to solve the VXLAN NAT traversal problem.



Work Experience

All of my Work Experience

Data Center Intern


Google Inc.
2021-06-28 ~ 2021-09-24

Developed a remote BIOS log system using C++ on ESP8266 and a Node.js full-stack application on GCP, streamlining technicians’ routines and reducing workload by 10% in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Monitored and resolved issues over 300,000 server and network devices at Asia’s largest Google TIER 4 Data Center.

Lead Software Engineer


Industry-Academy Cooperation, ISCOM-NYCU
2020-02-18 ~ 2022-06-30

Led a team of two engineers to increase manageability of multi-Kubernetes clusters by developing scalable metrics monitoring and alerting system, which is able to support for 10 million metrics, 90 days of data retention, and a remarkable reliability rate of 99.999% (five nines), with Prometheus, Distributed MQ and Grafana.

Software Engineer


Industry-Academy Cooperation, DLINK-NYCU
2020-02-18 ~ 2022-06-30

Designed an ONOS Capital Portal and 802.1x application for L2-switches by Java, delivering superior speed and flexibility in network management.

Systems & Networks Engineering Assistant


Computer Center, Computer Science Department, NYCU
2020-02-18 ~ 2022-06-30

Constructed a local repository server with a CI/CD pipeline, placing more than 30 customized packages for over 100 servers in the computing center. This strategic optimization streamlined processes and resulted in a 35% reduction in the software development life cycle. Oversaw the management of Linux/BSD workstations, Kubernetes clusters, and Cisco & Juniper network equipments that were used by more than 1000 professors and students in the computer science department.

System Engineer Intern Engineer


NEEDLE ROLLER BEARING CO., LTD.
2019-07-01 ~ 2019-08-31

Modernized factories by implementing a local-cloud-based solution with virtual machines (VMs) and Raspberry Pi for machine control, which can solve the issue of reduced computer lifespan in a factory environment, resulting in reducing 60% of hardware cost.



Other Projects

These include coursework, side projects and unpublished research work.

Simple Distributed File System


Project CS
2023-05-01

Developed a high-performance Simple Distributed File System using Golang, implementing the SWIM protocol for machine failure detection and quorum for data consistency. The system includes an auto-recovery feature that can withstand up to three simultaneous machine failures.

Data Structure & Programming


NYCU CS
2020-12-31

Implemented a compiler for a new programming language made by the professor. Using self-made symbol tables, combining a hash table and pointers to reduce 70% of searching time compared to simple linked lists.

Visualized Air Quality and Pothole Map


NYCU HackMeiChu (Hackathon)
2020-11-01

Led a team of five engineers in the development of a Visualized Air Quality and Pothole Map in HackMeiChu (Hackathon), leveraging a real-time C++ embedded system for data collection. The system is designed for high traffic, capable of processing over 10,000 requests per second.

Network Services Servers


NYCU System & Network Administration
2020-06-24

Built a cluster providing DHCP, DNS, Mail, FTP, and Web services, improving administrative scalability through LDAP for account management. Leveraged ZFS for automated backups and recovery, and implemented a reverse proxy server to block suspicious IPs.

Design and source code from Jon Barron's website
